result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanelli Kaye Madding

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SO2242908  Any Court Official may review

9:09AM Defendant Shanelli K. Madding not in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Murphy just appointed by State Public Defender office. Court orders warrant on defendant's non-appearance. $500 cash, reviewable by any Court official.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:47 AM Defendant Shanelli Kaye Madding in court in person in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Kyle Kunkel of the Rock County Sheriff's Office sworn testimony taken in person; Witness identified the defendant. Defendant wants to testify. Court advises defendant to wait for an attorney to be appointed. State moves for bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant. Court does not take a plea from defendant and stands mute on behalf of defendant, not guilty plea entered by Court. Court remands case to branch 3 for scheduling of appointment of an attorney.

3:06 PM   Defendant Shanelli Kaye Madding appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Shanelli Kaye Madding.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests preliminary hearing in person within time limits.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.
records.courtRptr: D Nelson / J Klaren / M Lindbloom

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.

4:17 PM  Defendant Shanelli Kaye Madding appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Shanelli Kaye Madding.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Conflict for public defenders office.  Attorney Tomaszewski has been appointed on other matters.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:25 PM Defendant Shanelli Kaye Madding appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Shanelli Kaye Madding.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued for Attorney to be present. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:24 PM Defendant Shanelli Kaye Madding appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No intentional contact with B.M. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone. Defendant to call public defenders office. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 3PM.
No intentional contact with B.M. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone.
